ovdesc.p: This facility enables the user to specify scheduled events which are to occur during the life of the contract.
Such events can include the definition and processing of some or all of the following components:
Principal Interest Commission Fees Margin revisions Rate revisions Diary entries
Updates to this file are effected solely by the user and the only functions users are allowed to perform are (L)IST, (E)XCEPTION, (S)EE, and (P)rint.
Input to this facility can only be via field DEFINE.SCHEDULES on LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS.
Upon responding YES to DEFINE SCHEDS and validating the contract the system will take you to the following input screen:
Where the following 9 items are automatically supplied by the system:

111 = Contract number 222 = Currency mnemonic 333 = Amount of contract (or Principal to be re-defined inclusive of forward dated principal increases) 444 = Start date of contract 555 = Maturity date of contract 666 = Payment method and category 777 = Customer mnemonic 888 = Interest rate type and interest basis 999 = Commission rate type and commission calculation method
The remaining items are described in detail in the remaining part of this manual.

This field indicates the schedule type that can be created by the user.
The user can input a single schedule or a valid combination of schedules eg PIC except the A schedule.

A combination of up to 3 schedule types each represented by a single alphabetic character of the form: A = Annuity (principal + interest) P = principal B = Principal Increase I = interest C = commission R = revision M = margin F = fees N = capitalised charge D = diary K = Asset Leasing schedule.
If a schedule type is input this must be of the form A, P, B, I, C, M, D, F, N, K, or R, or a valid combination of up to three e.g. PIC.
"P" schedules are only allowed for commitment contracts where the COMMIT.DRAWING field is set to NO.
"B" schedules are prohibited for Drawing commitment contracts and if interest basis is set to 'S'.
"N" shedules are prohibited for Commitment contract.
"C" schedules are prohibited for Deposit contracts.
"R" and "I" schedules are prohibited if no interest is due on the Contract.
"C" schedules are prohibited if no commission is due on the contract.
"P" & "I" & "C" schedules cannot be defined together as "PIC" when interest and commission is/are discounted.
"R" schedules cannot be combined with "I" schedules when interest is discounted as "R" schedules are prohibited for system date.
Multiple "I" schedules must be defined if the value in field CAPITALISATION = (Y)es on LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS.
"I" schedules must be defined alone if interest basis = "S".
"C" schedules must be defined alone if commission basis = "S".

"R" schedules are mandatory for PERIODIC.AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type. "R" schedules are mandatory for PERIODIC.MANUAL Interest Rate type. "R" schedules are prohibited for PERIODIC.STRAIGHT Interest Rate type. "R" schedules are prohibited from amending the next "R" date for PERIODIC.AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type. "R" schedules are prohibited for FLOATING Interest Rate type contracts. "R" schedules are prohibited if Interest Basis is "S". "R" - for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type only; a new "R" Schedule can only be input if an "R" Schedule is still outstanding. The new Schedule must be later than the existing Schedule.
"M" schedules are prohibited when no Interest due on the Contract. "M" schedules are prohibited for Fixed Interest Rate type. "M" schedules are prohibited for Commitments.

"K" schedules are only allowed for finance leasing annuity contracts, where a financial charge ( depreciation) is required and must be input after the "A" schedule is defined. Input can only take place for the following financial charge types: -
"RB" - reducing balance method, the dates and frequency must conform to the "A" schedule type, a depreciation rate must be input.
"FS" - flexible schedule method, using this method different rates can be applied over the life of the contract, and therefore a new "K" schedule must be input for each rate change.
"AN" and "SL" type financial charges do not require "K" schedules to be input as the schedule dates will conform to the "A" schedules, and no rate input is required.

This field indicates the charge code applicable to the "F", "N", "P", "I" or "A" schedules. This forms an association with the next field CHG.BASE.AMT to provide a flexible charge calculation mechanism.
Contains the id to the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record. The charge type may be RECEIVEable by the bank (i.e paid by the customer), or PAYable (paid by the bank).

A charge code must be defined with a type F schedule together with an AMOUNT. A charge code may also be linked to a P or I schedule, providing the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record is linked to a FT.CHARGE/ COMMISSION.TYPE. When A, P or I schedule with a linked charge is processed, the charge amount will be calculated according to the FT charge definition, based on the amount specified in CHG.BASE.AMT field.
Charges are debited or credited as follows:
Type F schedule RECEIVE debited from CHARG.LIQ.ACCT, PAY credited to FEE.PAY.ACCOUNT.
Type P schedule RECEIVE debited from PRIN.LIQ.ACCT, PAY credited to PRIN.LIQ.ACCT.
Type I schedule RECEIVE debited from INT.LIQ.ACCT, PAY credited to INT.LIQ.ACCT.
Receivable charges may be amortised if requried. This is denoted by the AMORTISATION field on the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record.
Example:
CHARGE.CODE 1 is a PAYABLE charge linked to a FT.COMMISSION.TYPE of 0.25% CHARGE.CODE 2 is a PAYABLE charge linked to a FT.COMMISSION.TYPE of 0.5% CHARGE.CODE 3 is a RECEIVABLE charge.
The following deposit schedules are defined for 31/03/96

On 31/03/96 the following entries will be raised:
Credit PRIN.LIQ.ACCT 25,000 USD Credit PRIN.LIQ.ACCT 25,000 * 0.25% = 62.50 USD (linked CHARGE.CODE 1)
Credit INT.LIQ.ACCT 1,000 USD Credit INT.LIQ.ACCT 1,000 * 0.5% = 5 USD (linked CHARGE.CODE 2)
Debit CHRG.LIQ.ACCOUNT 50 USD (Charge Code 3)

This field indicates the method which will be followed for the generation of schedules and the action which will be taken if the derived date is a non working day.

The user has three options avaliable when it comes to the generation of schedule dates. Either he can manually generate, date by date, the complete schedule plan or, the system can automatically generate the plan based on the input of salient data supplied by the user (amounts, frequencies etc.). Alternatively, a combination of the previous two methods can be employed.
Additionally the field indicates the method to be employed if the user opts for automatic generation of schedules and the date derived by the system is a non-working day in the relative currency.
The following provides an explanation of the various input values for this field:
If the derived day is a non working day the system response will be:
1 = forward The system will go forward to the next working day.
2 = backward The system will go backward to the last working day.
3 = fwd same month The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month the system will go backward to the last working day.

4 = not automatic The user has not opted for the automatic generation of schedules and consequently must specify each and every event date. If non-working days are specified the system will prompt for overides.
5 = Calendar The system will use the same date irrespective of whether dates cycled are working days or not.
A single numeric value in the range 1-5. 1 = Forward 2 = Backward 3 = Forward same month 4 = Not automatic 5 = Calendar (Single value field. Default = 4)
Input must be a value in the range 1-5.
Input of 4 is mandatory if interest basis "S" is used.
Input of 5 is mandatory for Annuity contracts

The value in this field indicates to the system how the future event dates are to be computed.
1 = base The system will use the first scheduled date entered to compute the subsequent event date(s).
2 = previous The system will use the last computed schedule date in order to compute the subsequent event date.
3 = not automaticThe user has opted for the manual definition of dates.

SCH.TYPE
This field indicates the schedule type that can be created by the user. The user can input a single schedule or a valid combination of schedules eg PIC except the A schedule.
Validation Rules

A combination of up to 3 schedule types each represented by a single alphabetic character of the form: A = Annuity (principal + interest) P = principal I = interest C = commission R = revision M = margin F = fees N = capitalised charge D = diary K = Asset Leasing schedule. If a schedule type is input this must be of the form A, P, I, C, M, D, F, N, K, or R, or a valid combination of up to three e.g. PIC. "P" schedules are only allowed for commitment contracts where the COMMIT.DRAWING field is set to NO. "N" shedules are prohibited for Commitment contract. "C" schedules are prohibited for Deposit contracts. "R" and "I" schedules are prohibited if no interest is due on the Contract. "C" schedules are prohibited if no commission is due on the contract. "P" & "I" & "C" schedules cannot be defined together as "PIC" when interest and commission is/are discounted. "R" schedules cannot be combined with "I" schedules when interest is discounted as "R" schedules are prohibited for system date. Multiple "I" schedules must be defined if the value in field CAPITALISATION = (Y)es on LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS. "I" schedules must be defined alone if interest basis = "S". "C" schedules must be defined alone if commission basis = "S". "R" schedules are mandatory for PERIODIC.AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type. "R" schedules are mandatory for PERIODIC.MANUAL Interest Rate type. "R" schedules are prohibited for PERIODIC.STRAIGHT Interest Rate type. "R" schedules are prohibited from amending the next "R" date for PERIODIC.AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type. "R" schedules are prohibited for FLOATING Interest Rate type contracts. "R" schedules are prohibited if Interest Basis is "S". "R" - for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type only; a new "R" Schedule can only be input if an "R" Schedule is still outstanding. The new Schedule must be later than the existing Schedule. "M" schedules are prohibited when no Interest due on the Contract. "M" schedules are prohibited for Fixed Interest Rate type. "M" schedules are prohibited for Commitments. "K" schedules are only allowed for finance leasing annuity contracts, where a financial charge ( depreciation) is required and must be input after the "A" schedule is defined. Input can only take place for the following financial charge types: - "RB" - reducing balance method, the dates and frequency must conform to the "A" schedule type, a depreciation rate must be input. "FS" - flexible schedule method, using this method different rates can be applied over the life of the contract, and therefore a new "K" schedule must be input for each rate change. "AN" and "SL" type financial charges do not require "K" schedules to be input as the schedule dates will conform to the "A" schedules, and no rate input is required.

CHARGE.CODE

This field indicates the charge code applicable to the "F", "N", "P", "I" or "A" schedules. This forms an association with the next field CHG.BASE.AMT to provide a flexible charge calculation mechanism. Contains the id to the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record. The charge type may be RECEIVEable by the bank (i.e paid by the customer), or PAYable (paid by the bank). A charge code must be defined with a type F schedule together with an AMOUNT. A charge code may also be linked to a P or I schedule, providing the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record is linked to a FT.CHARGE/ COMMISSION.TYPE. When A, P or I schedule with a linked charge is processed, the charge amount will be calculated according to the FT charge definition, based on the amount specified in CHG.BASE.AMT field. Charges are debited or credited as follows: Type F schedule RECEIVE debited from CHARG.LIQ.ACCT, PAY credited to FEE.PAY.ACCOUNT. Type P schedule RECEIVE debited from PRIN.LIQ.ACCT, PAY credited to PRIN.LIQ.ACCT. Type I schedule RECEIVE debited from INT.LIQ.ACCT, PAY credited to INT.LIQ.ACCT. Receivable charges may be amortised if requried. This is denoted by the AMORTISATION field on the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record. Example: CHARGE.CODE 1 is a PAYABLE charge linked to a FT.COMMISSION.TYPE of 0.25% CHARGE.CODE 2 is a PAYABLE charge linked to a FT.COMMISSION.TYPE of 0.5% CHARGE.CODE 3 is a RECEIVABLE charge. The following deposit schedules are defined for 31/03/96 Type P 25,000 USD Charge Code 1 Type I Charge Code 2 (Interest Amount 1,000 USD) Type F 50 USD Charge Code 3 On 31/03/96 the following entries will be raised: Credit PRIN.LIQ.ACCT 25,000 USD Credit PRIN.LIQ.ACCT 25,000 * 0.25% = 62.50 USD (linked CHARGE.CODE 1) Credit INT.LIQ.ACCT 1,000 USD Credit INT.LIQ.ACCT 1,000 * 0.5% = 5 USD (linked CHARGE.CODE 2) Debit CHRG.LIQ.ACCOUNT 50 USD (Charge Code 3) This must be a valid charge code as defined on the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS table.
Validation Rules

1-3 numeric characters. Must be a valid entry on LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS. For "N" type schedules the value entered here must not have a value of YES in the MTHLY.AMORTISATION field of the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record. For "A", "P" or "I" schedules the value entered must be defined in LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS with a linked CHARGE.CODE.KE.
